result.execSummary:
The defendant Dejuan M Mcgowan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Standard court costs waived. DNA Surcharge to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing on 12-01-2022. Penalty of civil judgment for non- 
 payment. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff 
 Department.
-Court orders forfeiture and destruction of firearm taken on this case.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dejuan M Mcgowan

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM Defendant Dejuan M Mcgowan in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Dejuan M Mcgowan.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. There is no victim on this case. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1.Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of count #1. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:	
Costs:  WAIVED
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month, starting 12/01/2022 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  entry of civil judgment
Court orders forfeiture and destruction of firearm taken on this case

Appeal rights given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:33 AM Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Dejuan M Mcgowan. Defendant Dejuan M Mcgowan in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests a plea/sentencing hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Proof of Concealed Carry Course, filed by Atty Kershek

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
03:58 PM Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Dejuan M Mcgowan did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Kershek states that his client is having transportation issues and requests a stayed capias. Atty Kershek states that the Defendant has taken his CCW class. Atty Kershek has discovery but needs an offer. 
State will forward an offer. 
Court will issue a capias, but stay it to the next hearing date.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

File not called on the record.
Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dejuan M Mcgowan in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  

Defense is still waiting on discovery and an offer.
  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Clerk's letter to defendant regarding court-appointed attorney.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.
Repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing June 1, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
09:18 AM Defendant Dejuan M Mcgowan in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing June 1, 2022.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A PAYMENT PLAN.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
